skill.name: ai-ssh-ftp-proxy
skill.description: AI Agent Skill for executing SSH commands and FTP operations on remote servers via a proxy service.
skill.summary: Enables AI agents to access remote servers through SSH command execution, FTP file operations, and WebSocket interactive sessions. All data is Base64 encoded.
skill.author: AI_SSH_FTP Project

security_audit.summary: This skill provides a proxy service that executes commands on remote servers. Credentials are stored server-side. All data is Base64 encoded to prevent injection. Deploy on trusted networks only.
medium_findings: Executes arbitrary commands on remote servers via SSH
Transfers files to/from remote servers via FTP

content.user_title: Remote Server Access for AI Agents
content.value_statement: AI agents need to execute commands and transfer files on remote servers. This skill provides a secure proxy service with HTTP and WebSocket APIs.
actual_capabilities: Execute shell commands on remote servers via HTTP API
List, upload, and download files via FTP API
Base64 encoding for safe data transmission
limitations: Requires pre-deployed proxy service on target server

use_cases.title: Server Automation
use_cases.description: Enable AI agents to deploy code, run scripts, and manage server configurations.

use_cases.title: Remote Operations
use_cases.description: Execute maintenance tasks on remote servers programmatically.

use_cases.title: File Management
use_cases.description: Upload/download configuration files and logs via FTP.

prompt_templates.title: Execute SSH Command
prompt_templates.scenario: Run a command on remote server
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the ssh_exec skill to run 'ls -la /' on the remote server. Remember to Base64 encode the command.

prompt_templates.title: List FTP Directory
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the ftp_list skill to list files in the root directory. Encode the path '/' as Base64.

prompt_templates.title: Upload File
prompt_templates.prompt: Use ftp_upload to upload a test file. Encode both the path and content as Base64.

best_practices: Always Base64 encode inputs and decode outputs
Use SSH key authentication instead of passwords when possible
Deploy proxy service on private network with firewall rules
Monitor server logs for unauthorized access attempts
anti_patterns: Exposing proxy service to public internet without authentication

faq.question: Why is Base64 encoding required?
faq.answer: Base64 ensures safe transmission of binary data and special characters, preventing injection attacks and parsing errors.

faq.question: Can I use this with multiple servers?
faq.answer: Each proxy instance connects to one target server. Deploy multiple instances for multiple servers.

faq.question: How do I use the WebSocket interactive session?
faq.answer: Connect to ws://server:48892/ws/ssh and send JSON messages with type 'input' and Base64-encoded payload.
